Class Exercises

  • java.lang.Object
    • Exercises

  • public class Exercises
extends java.lang.Object
    The class contains the 7 functions to be completed in the exam.
    Author:
    Ignacio.Castineiras

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Exercises()
      Constructor of the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ex1()
      The function prints your name by the screen.
      Example: In my case it will print Christian
      int ex2(int a, int b)
      The function declares a new variable res, assigns it to the sum of 'a' and 'b' and returns res.
      Example: If a = 3 and b = 5 then it returns 8 (which is 3 + 5)
      void ex3(int a, int b, int c)
      The function receives 3 numbers and prints by screen the biggest of them.
      Example: If a = 3, b = 7 and c = 5, then it prints 7 (which is the biggest of the 3 numbers).
      int ex4(int n)
      The function returns the sum of all numbers from 1 to n.
      Example: If n = 5, the function returns 15 (which is 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5).
      void ex5(int n)
      The function prints a pattern by screen.
      Example1: If n = 3, then it prints
      *
      **
      ***
      Example2: If n = 5, then it prints
      *
      **
      ***
      ****
      *****
      java.lang.String ex6(java.lang.String s)
      The function reverses a String and returns the String reversed.
      Example: If the String "Hello" is received, then it returns "olleH"
      int ex7(int n)
      NOTE: This exercise has been taken from CodeWars:
      https://www.codewars.com/kata/sum-of-digits-slash-digital-root
      Description:
      A digital root is the recursive sum of all the digits in a number.
      Given n, take the sum of the digits of n.
      If that value has still more than one digit, continue reducing in this way until a single-digit number is produced.

      Example 1:
      ex7(16)
      1 + 6
      7

      Example 2:
      ex7(942)
      9 + 4 + 2
      15
      However, as 15 still contains more than one digit, we iterate again
      1 + 5
      6

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public void ex1()
        The function prints your name by the screen.
        Example: In my case it will print Christian

      • ex2

        public int ex2(int a,
               int b)
        The function declares a new variable res, assigns it to the sum of 'a' and 'b' and returns res.
        Example: If a = 3 and b = 5 then it returns 8 (which is 3 + 5)
        Parameters:
        a: - First Integer
        b: - Second Integer
        Returns:
        Sum of a and b

      • ex3

        public void ex3(int a,
                int b,
                int c)
        The function receives 3 numbers and prints by screen the biggest of them.
        Example: If a = 3, b = 7 and c = 5, then it prints 7 (which is the biggest of the 3 numbers).
        Parameters:
        a: - First number
        b: - Second number
        c: - Third number

      • ex4

        public int ex4(int n)
        The function returns the sum of all numbers from 1 to n.
        Example: If n = 5, the function returns 15 (which is 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5).
        Parameters:
        n: - Number we want to stop adding at
        Returns:
        Sum of all integers in [1..n]

      • ex5

        public void ex5(int n)
        The function prints a pattern by screen.
        Example1: If n = 3, then it prints
        *
        **
        ***
        Example2: If n = 5, then it prints
        *
        **
        ***
        ****
        *****
        Parameters:
        n: - Number of lines to be printed

      • ex6

        public java.lang.String ex6(java.lang.String s)
        The function reverses a String and returns the String reversed.
        Example: If the String "Hello" is received, then it returns "olleH"
        Parameters:
        s: - String to be scanned.
        Returns:
        The reversed String.

      • ex7

        public int ex7(int n)
        NOTE: This exercise has been taken from CodeWars:
        https://www.codewars.com/kata/sum-of-digits-slash-digital-root
        Description:
        A digital root is the recursive sum of all the digits in a number.
        Given n, take the sum of the digits of n.
        If that value has still more than one digit, continue reducing in this way until a single-digit number is produced.

        Example 1:
        ex7(16)
        1 + 6
        7

        Example 2:
        ex7(942)
        9 + 4 + 2
        15
        However, as 15 still contains more than one digit, we iterate again
        1 + 5
        6
        Parameters:
        n: - Number to apply its digital root to.
        Returns:
        res: Digital result of the number.
